segment.source: How to Customize Virtual Applications Extensions for a Specific AD Group by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Customize Virtual Applications Extensions for a Specific AD Group by Using the Management Console

segment.source: How to Customize Virtual Applications Extensions for a Specific AD Group by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Customize Virtual Applications Extensions for a Specific AD Group by Using the Management Console

segment.source: How to Customize Virtual Applications Extensions for a Specific AD Group by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Customize Virtual Applications Extensions for a Specific AD Group by Using the Management Console

segment.source: Use the following procedure to customize the virtual application extensions for an Active Directory (AD) group.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to customize the virtual application extensions for an Active Directory (AD) group.

segment.source: To customize virtual applications extensions for an AD group
segment.target: To customize virtual applications extensions for an AD group

segment.source: To view the package that you want to configure, open the App-V 5.0 Management Console.
segment.target: To view the package that you want to configure, open the App-V 5.0 Management Console.

segment.source: To view the configuration that is assigned to a given user group, select the package, and right-click the package name and select Edit active directory access.
segment.target: To view the configuration that is assigned to a given user group, select the package, and right-click the package name and select Edit active directory access.

segment.source: Alternatively, select the package and click EDIT in the AD ACCESS pane.
segment.target: Alternatively, select the package and click EDIT in the AD ACCESS pane.

segment.source: To customize an AD group, you can find the group from the list of AD Entities with Access.
segment.target: To customize an AD group, you can find the group from the list of AD Entities with Access.

segment.source: Then, using the drop-down box in the Assigned Configuration pane, select Custom, and then click EDIT.
segment.target: Then, using the drop-down box in the Assigned Configuration pane, select Custom, and then click EDIT.

segment.source: To disable all extensions for a given application, clear ENABLE.
segment.target: To disable all extensions for a given application, clear ENABLE.

segment.source: To add a new shortcut for the selected application, right-click the application in the SHORTCUTS pane, and select Add new shortcut.
segment.target: To add a new shortcut for the selected application, right-click the application in the SHORTCUTS pane, and select Add new shortcut.

segment.source: To remove a shortcut, right-click the application in the SHORTCUTS pane, and select Remove Shortcut.
segment.target: To remove a shortcut, right-click the application in the SHORTCUTS pane, and select Remove Shortcut.

segment.source: To edit an existing shortcut, right-click the application, and select Edit Shortcut.
segment.target: To edit an existing shortcut, right-click the application, and select Edit Shortcut.

segment.source: To view any other application extensions, click Advanced, and click Export Configuration.
segment.target: To view any other application extensions, click Advanced, and click Export Configuration.

segment.source: Type in a filename and click Save.
segment.target: Type in a filename and click Save.

segment.source: You can view all application extensions that are associated with the package using the configuration file.
segment.target: You can view all application extensions that are associated with the package using the configuration file.

segment.source: To edit additional application extensions, modify the configuration file and click Import and Overwrite this Configuration.
segment.target: To edit additional application extensions, modify the configuration file and click Import and Overwrite this Configuration.

segment.source: Select the modified file and click Open.
segment.target: Select the modified file and click Open.

segment.source: In the dialog, click Overwrite to complete the process.
segment.target: In the dialog, click Overwrite to complete the process.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?
